metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: To be able to log into the admin application, we need to create a user.
content.html: To be able to log into the admin application, we need to create a user.

content.text: This is done by typing this command in the command view:
content.html: This is done by typing this command in the command view:

content.code_html: python manage.py createsuperuser

content.text: Here you must enter: username, e-mail address, (you can just pick a fake e-mail address), and password:
content.html: Here you must enter: username, e-mail address, (you can just pick a fake e-mail address), and password:

content.code:
Username: johndoe

Email address: johndoe@dummymail.com

Password:

Password (again):

This password is too short. It must contain at least 8 characters.

This password is too common.

This password is entirely numeric.

Bypass password validation and create user anyway? [y/N]:
content.code_html:
Username: johndoe
Email address: johndoe@dummymail.com
Password:
Password (again):
This password is too short. It must contain at least 8 characters.
This password is too common.
This password is entirely numeric.
Bypass password validation and create user anyway? [y/N]:

content.text: My password did not meet the criteria, but this is a test environment, and I choose to create user anyway, by enter y:
content.html: My password did not meet the criteria, but this is a test environment, and I choose to create user anyway, by enter y:

content.code: Bypass password validation and create user anyway? [y/N]: y
content.code_html: Bypass password validation and create user anyway? [y/N]: y

content.text: If you press [Enter], you should have successfully created a user:
content.html: If you press [Enter], you should have successfully created a user:

content.code_html: Superuser created successfully.
python manage.py runserver

content.text: In the browser window, type 127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ in the address bar.
content.html: In the browser window, type 127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ in the address bar.

content.text: And fill in the form with the correct username and password:
content.html: And fill in the form with the correct username and password:

content.text: Which should result in this user interface:
content.html: Which should result in this user interface:

content.text: Here you can create, read, update, and delete groups and users, but where is the Members model?
content.html: Here you can create, read, update, and delete groups and users, but where is the Members model?

content.text: The Members model is missing, as it should be, you have to tell Django which models that should be visible in the admin interface.
content.html: The Members model is missing, as it should be, you have to tell Django which models that should be visible in the admin interface.

content.text: You will learn how to include the Members model in the next chapter .
content.html: You will learn how to include the Members model in the next chapter.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct syntax to create a user in the Django Admin interface?
content.html: What is the correct syntax to create a user in the Django Admin interface?
